intro: Statice gomezi-jordanae, commonly known as the Jordanian statice, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the Middle East and North Africa. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family, and is characterized by its compact growth habit and dense clusters of small, showy flowers. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, with deep root systems that allow it to access water from deeper soil layers. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink and purple, are often used in ornamental gardening due to their resilience and aesthetic appeal. Statice gomezi-jordanae plays an important ecological role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing habitat for small insects and pollinators.
